Package jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework

Class Scenario

java.lang.Object
jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework.Scenario
public class Scenario extends Object
This class represents a scenario that can be executed by the TestFramework.

A JTreg test should use the test framework with @run driver (without directly specify any additional flags). If a test should run with additional flags, use TestFramework.runWithFlags(String...) or TestFramework.addFlags(String...). If, however, the test should be run with different settings (equivalent to having multiple @run entries in a normal JTreg test), use scenarios. A scenario will be run with the scenario specific VM flags, if any, and optionally specified VM flags with TestFramework.addFlags(String...) whereas scenario VM flags will have precedence.

There is also the possibility to specify additional VM flags for all scenarios by using DScenarioFlags.

See Also:
TestFramework

  • Constructor Details

    • Scenario

      public Scenario​(int index, String... flags)
      Create a scenario with index that will be run with the additional VM flags specified in flags (or without any if null or parameter not provided).

      The scenario index must be unique to be distinguishable in the stdout and stderr output and when specifying -DScenarios (see Scenario).

      Parameters:
      index - the unique scenario index.
      flags - the scenario flags or null (i.e. no parameter specified) if no flags should be used.

  • Method Details

    • addFlags

      public void addFlags​(String... flags)
      Add additional VM flags to this scenario.
      Parameters:
      flags - the additional scenario VM flags.

      Returns:

    • getTestVMOutput

      public String getTestVMOutput()
      Get the test VM output (stdout + stderr) of this scenario from the last execution of the framework.
      Returns:
      the test VM output.
